title: Gift for Someone Who Already Has an Espresso Machine
headline: They have the machine. Give them the upgrade they haven't bought themselves.
editorial_intro: The best gifts for someone who already owns an espresso machine are the tools they know they want but keep postponing — the accessories that transform a good setup into a great one. Here are three tiers, from thoughtful stocking fillers to serious upgrades.

products.description: Most home baristas are still using the plastic tamper that came in the box. A properly weighted, flat-base 58mm tamper is the kind of upgrade they will use twice a day and think of you each time.
An anti-static stainless steel dosing cup that transfers grounds cleanly from grinder to portafilter. It solves a daily annoyance they may not even realise they have.
Backflush tablets, a group head brush, and microfibre cloths. Not glamorous, but deeply practical — and the sort of thing they will never buy for themselves.
If they are grinding with a blade grinder or an old hand-crank model, the Macinino is a revelation. Twenty stepped settings, conical burrs, and a compact footprint that fits beside any machine.
An adjustable-depth distribution tool paired with a precision scale. Together, these two items will improve their shots more noticeably than almost any other single purchase.
A 0.1g scale with integrated shot timer. Once they start weighing dose and yield, there is no going back. This is the gift that turns instinct into understanding.
The single most impactful upgrade for anyone pulling shots on a decent machine. Stepless adjustment and near-zero retention mean every bag of beans gets dialled in properly for the first time.
For the person whose espresso obsession has become a genuine craft. Competition-grade 64mm flat burrs and true zero retention — the grinder that stops being the bottleneck.
